alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Miami; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 1:50AM EDT until July 29 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Fulton IN County in north central Indiana... Southwestern Kosciusko County in north central Indiana... Southern Marshall County in north central Indiana... Northwestern Miami County in north central Indiana... Northeastern Pulaski County in northwestern Indiana... Southeastern Starke County in northwestern Indiana... * Until 400 AM EDT /300 AM CDT/. * At 150 AM EDT /1250 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Knox, Argos, Culver, Akron, Mentone, Mexico, Walnut, Tippecanoe, Oak Grove, Kewanna, Erie, Denver, Fulton, Monterey, Macy, Burket, Tiosa, Leiters Ford and Lake Manitou. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Miami; Pulaski; Starke
